website_summaries.verdict: While pricey and a little difficult to mount, this helmet mirror's stability and clear image are well worth the money and effort.
pros: Great steady image with no distortion
Good-size mirror that securely mounts to your helmet
cons: The price is quite a bit higher than other models
Finding the best mounting position on your helmet can be a bit challenging
Easy to knock out of alignment when you remove your helmet

customer_reviews.text: The guys I ride with make fun of me because the mirror is larger than any of theirs but I love it. I gives me a wide view of what is behind me and since I am a fashionista and have multiple helmets I have purchased several. Once installed they are difficult to move to another helmet. It is a ball and socket device and if the mirror comes loose which only happens with a bad knock or me throwing helmet in car ---- I have to have my husband push it back together as I am not strong enough.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: I haft say - really kinda ticks me off
customer_reviews.text: I'm thinking that when you pay $40 for a little mirror, you should expect quality. This might work well, but I can't get it onto my helmet. First, really crappy directions. Second, pretty worthless velcro - at least for me. Now, I realize that a person with "skills" might be able to figure this out pretty easily, but for the rest of us, it is a struggle. I mean, how hard would it be to have a little video on Amazon. I may figure this out and change my mind and keep it, but right now, it is just very frustrating trying to make the velcro things work without breaking them as the mirror flops all around.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Essential Piece of Bicycling Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mirror. Great field of vision. Attaches easily and securely to the helmet. Stays in place once adjusted with no issues. Love it. Made riding so much safer and made me feel great anytime I was on a busy street being able to see the cars coming up behind me. Would highly recommend it. Not sure why people would say it's too big. It doesn't obstruct my view at all and offers a good view behind me.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Where is the Mirror?
customer_reviews.text: Good idea done poorly. Arm mechanism works great. attaching to the helmet is a bit of a pain, nothing a good double sided adhesive tape would not fix. The real problem is the mirror is extremely BAD quality. Not even a mirror just a piece if silver plastic, out of focus, blurry, mostly useless. I glued a 2" cat eye glass mirror to the one it came with and works fine. Pity the company is so cheap they could not spend the few extra cents for a real mirror, would have gladly paid a couple more bucks to get a good mirror, that is really what your buying in the end. So I can't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: brian johnson

customer_reviews.title: The best mirror we've used in 17 years.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been riding tandem for 17 years. This is by far the best mirror we have used. We have 3 years with this model, and have to say it was worth the price. The large size AND flexible gooseneck are keys to its top-notch usabilty. (comparisons, a few years each: The Bike Peddler Take-a-Look, our first = tiny mirror, short stem, tangs that bent metal glasses frames. next the CycleAware, with an adhesive mount - better, but a small mirror and frail: the mirror "ball" adjustment broke.)
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Flat Mirror - tough to see anything behind you
customer_reviews.text: I realize that this product has many good reviews but it won't work for me. The flat mirror has a very narrow viewing area which makes me take my eyes off the road ahead and move my head to see whats behind me. Of course it is bigger than some other tiny helmet and glasses mirrors but smaller than handlebar mirrors. And the price is pretty high for the flimsy product so I can buy 3 handlebar mirrors for the price of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy

customer_reviews.title: not easy to install properly
customer_reviews.text: well, after reading the 5 stars reviews, I was convinced...but after buying it , and trying to attach it to the helmet...well, that was hard ( no instructions included). after a long struggle I managed to attach it, and trying it on the bike...very hard to stay in one position, and the best way, to see, would be to cup the mirror with my left hand while cycling and holding it in one position, while looking at the mirror...( not very safe, but i had to compromise)...I think the best way , would be a handle bar mirror....and leave the helmet free of any other stuff
customer_reviews.author: geronimo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, easy to use and clear view!!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE BEST mirror I have found! It's very easy to attach and adjust, gives a large CLEAR view of oncoming vehicles and other riders and stays in place!! I have bought these for many family members. We were disappointed that the adhesive is no longer part of the package. It kept the mirror solid and we are not confident the ties and velcro can do the job alone. We'll see.. But if it doesn't, once you have it on and know you like it, I suppose superglue would work?
customer_reviews.author: MMB

customer_reviews.title: 2 years and a Macgyver
customer_reviews.text: This works well for me. I understand that when you buy something like this you simply expect it to work seamlessly but unfortunately there are so many helmets types there is a risk. I will admit I had to Macgyver attaching it to my helmet a bit by using zip ties. But I feel been well worth the effort. I wear glasses and there’s a tad of adjustment if the mirror moves. After that all I have to do is glance and I know what’s behind me. I wouldn’t use a bike mounted mirror ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Sintillator

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet mirror, BUT BE AWARE:
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this mirror to go with the new bicycle helmet I got from Amazon as well:  The problem is - this helmet, while a great value, only has 4 vents on top, and 2 on the front. There's no way to secure it using the cable & Velcro ties supplied! Fortunately, I'm an avid DIYer (Do-It-Yourselfer), so I had longer 12" cable ties available. I had to use 2 of these - 1 on top & one on the front - EACH TIE PASSING THRU BOTH VENTS, to properly secure this mirror. If your helmet is similar to mine - be prepared to "enhance" it yourself - just like I did. Words to the wise!
customer_reviews.author: Chris JungTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very well made product.
customer_reviews.text: I like this mirror very much. I used a smaller mirror for several years now, and decided to try this one. It gives a wide field of view because of the size and once adjusted stays in place. It is a bit tricky to get positioned just right but there are velcro zip ties included so you can tweak the helmet mount location before using the permanent zip ties. I would suggest do the temporary mount and then get on the bike to tweak and make sure of the mount position. The only complaint is I wish the mirror swiveled at the end of the mounting arm but this is a very minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P

customer_reviews.title: Good Sturdy Review Mirror
customer_reviews.text: If you need a good, sturdy, rearview mirror for cycling; look no further. This works very well. You'll to adjust it each time before you ride because it may get knocked out of alignment when you take your helmet off. Also, you may have to move your head slightly to see oncoming traffic. Those are my only grips about this product. It fits over your visor (if you have one) and the ties do a good job of holding it in place. Last, It can be distracting while riding too because you'll be tempted to view oncoming traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Consorte

customer_reviews.title: Nice but wobbly
customer_reviews.text: All the parts of the mirror are rock-solid-stable and very nicely functional. To me, the woe is in the attachment of the mirror to the bicycle helmet. With the provided hardware, the result is a wobbly mirror, and looking at the physics I can't imagine how it could ever not be wobbly. Bicycle helmets and their air gaps are just too awkwardly-shaped, and you just can't cinch down zip ties tightly enough, for the mirror to keep a solid grip. I solved that problem with a layer of gaffer tape. I'm fine with that overall, but when I think that I paid $40 for a tiny mirror and still needed gaffer tape, I can't quite give the coveted five-star rating.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tsurikov

customer_reviews.title: Finally!  A cycling mirror that works and is trouble-free!
customer_reviews.text: Forget the bar-end mirrors! Forget the eyeglass-mounted mirrors. Forget other helmet-mounted mirrors. I've tried and tossed them all! Tossed them all except for this one, that is. It's stable! It has a good field of (rear) view (without occluding your forward vision). In short, it works and it's great! I found that a minor trim on the mounting foot enabled a better fit into the helmet grooves and a couple of zip-ties ensured a permanent, unmoving, anchor. This is the last cycling mirror that I'll buy (unless I crash and destroy it, in which case I'll buy the same product again).
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: then one that fit but the mirror was crap, lol
customer_reviews.text: Purple's Reviews: I have an EcoTad recumbent electric trike. I bought mirrors for the handlebars, to much vibration to see. I bought a hemlet mirror that didn't fit, then one that fit but the mirror was crap, lol. Ok now I spent the big money on this. It fits! It will probably fit on any helmet. I can see!!! Clear as crystal and I mean I can see everything! The unit is sturdy, the mirror stays where you put it and I CAN SEE!!!!! Spend the money for this, it's worth it. Great product and great value...
customer_reviews.author: David Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Large view, fully adjustable and stable. Best helmet mirror I have ever found.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other bike helmet mirrors that generally are difficult to adjust, too small, and fall off the helmet. This one is great! It is fully adjustable with the flexible arm. It is securely attached to the helmet and therefore 100% stable. The mirror is very large. It isn’t sexy, but most importantly, is very functional. The people who say it is not flexible, don’t know how to use flexible arms (don’t be afraid to bend it). And the real geniuses that claim the vision is foggy didn’t figure out they needed to remove the plastic film. Yes, the one that comes with every glass surface to keep it from scratching.
customer_reviews.author: Carol N.

customer_reviews.title: Stable Mirror
customer_reviews.text: I am getting back into biking in my senior years. Looking behind me is not as easy as it was 40 years ago. This mirror was easy to mount to my (first ever) helmet. It took a few rides to get adjusted to my satisfaction. The adjustments are tight enough to stay set and not shake while riding, giving a stable rear view. It was worth the high price to get it right the first time!
customer_reviews.author: Preacher G

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I fitted it to my mountain bike helmet using gaffer tape so that it can be easily removed when trail riding. This mirror provides a good rear view when I ride in public spaces where I may encounter other riders, pedestrians and cars. The view is easily adjusted to optimize the viewing angle. It cost as much as my MTB helmet (a cheapy) but is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: pberguy

customer_reviews.title: The best I've been able to find
customer_reviews.text: It takes a while to align it, but while riding looking forward I need not turn my head to see what is behind me so I am generally aware of what is behind me without needing to make an effort to find out. I did have to drill holes in my helmet. The main problem with it is that the slightest bump throws it out of adjustment. Forty years ago I had a helmet-mounted mirror that was better. It held the mirror on a spring. You could bump it and it would spring back to proper alignment. Imagine control with four thumbscrews, two on the mirror and two on the mount.
customer_reviews.author: Jclaer

customer_reviews.title: Next to your helmet, without a doubt the best investment in your safety
customer_reviews.text: $40 for a mirror? The price seems ridiculous. I've never taken the time to write a review before, but I can not recommend this highly enough.. I've ridden bikes in the US, Canada, and Europe for over 50 years. Nothing else compares for adjustability, stability, clarity, and field of view. A helmet helps only if you crash. Aside from riding safely, this is arguably the single best way to avoid getting hit. And it virtually eliminates that nagging anxiety about what's coming up behind me that takes a little of the pleasure out of every ride. It's expensive until you compare it with the price of peace of mind and the deductible on your medical insurance.
customer_reviews.author: Merlinxl

customer_reviews.title: 5 years later, I'd buy another one today if I lost my helmet.
customer_reviews.text: Every other mirror I've tried over fifty-some years of cycling has had some serious flaw. This has none. It is quality all the way, a design perfectly perfected. One huge benefit of helmet mirrors is the lack of vibration in the image when you glance at it. Don't underestimate this if you are new to bike mirrors. And this helmet mirror, in my experience, is the best of them all. As for the price, it is well worth it. Is your life or head worth the money? Mine is.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Stable, light, but the optics are not great
customer_reviews.text: I use this mirror, and will stick with it, but for the price the optics could be better. I've spent a fair bit of time in the lab with laser mirrors, so I have a decent idea of what's possible. My Hafty handlebar-mounted mirror has a better optical surface than does this mirror. Of course, when you use a helmet-mounted mirror, you look like a dork. But for safety, it's worth it. Being able to maintain situational awareness of the road behind you is important. I still do a shoulder check before making any significant move to the left, every time.
customer_reviews.author: MAF

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Once set in the "sweet spot" the mirror is great, especially with the large lens. It is a bit problematic to mount on some helmets. I have a POC and it took a while to figure out the mounting. EVT was nice enough to send me additional mounting pieces so I could extend the mirror to where the lens is comfortable. Since the mounting is articulated it constantly needs adjusting especially if you are not careful when you take the helmet off. All said, once the helmet is on and you readjust the mirror lens, it has a great field of view.
customer_reviews.author: kenh

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME rear view but sucky mounting options. Use double sided tape.
customer_reviews.text: Great view from the mirror and the flexible arm makes it a breeze adjusting one handed while biking. Only 4 out 5 stars because the mounting sucks. You are given Velcro and plastic zip ties to affix through the helmet’s ventilation. My helmet is an urban style helmet without adequate holes for mounting. I ended up just using automotive grade double sided tape. Once it’s on though it’s a great mirror!
customer_reviews.author: Laurence619

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind while riding
customer_reviews.text: Just used this on a 400 mile tour on mountain highways. Bigger than other mirrors and quite easy and stable to use... Just rotate your head ever so slightly to the left. Also can be dismounted when you don't need it. The biggest benefit is that you can clearly see when a vehicle behind you IS giving you space.. So you worry less. Tip: attach it with velcro only and experiment with it a while until you find the perfect spot for you. Then lock it in tight with zip ties and the stability of the image will become excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Chowderhead

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror big and easy to see
customer_reviews.text: After over a decade of not riding a bicycle we started riding again with new bikes and helmets. Quickly figured out we needed mirrors and went searching. These are not the least expensive ones out there but they work great. Large to see enough behind us and easy to adjust. We just love these. [2018 May 29 update] We were in a crowd at the Indy 500 and somehow lost one of the mirrors. So I'm buying a replacement. Word of advice if in a big crowd pull the mirror off the helmet to not lose it. I will stow it in my bag from now on. Expensive lesson so learn from my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Alex P.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I can't imagine anyone being sorry for buying this great mirror!
customer_reviews.text: Love this mirror! It's large and I can see well what's coming from behind me. The part that attaches the mirror to the helmet is a series of strong, tightly-fitting pop-beads popped onto a plastic strip which is zip-tied onto the helmet. It can take a few minutes to get the mirror adjusted because the pop-beads fit tightly together, but once adjusted, it doesn't go out of adjustment easily. This thing is a bit pricey, but I have not been sorry I bought it. Actually, I purchased a second one of these mirrors for my daughter because I like it so much better than the handlebar mirror I used to use.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Guy

customer_reviews.title: Steady, clear and easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I bought one and then bought another later for a friend. The first install took longer but I now feel very comfortable with the install. The velcro was shakey so I added a piece of heavy duty double sided tape before positioning the mirror stem to the helmet. The tape made the nylon zipties easier to position and cinch up. One ziptie wasn't long enough so I chained two together to wrap through the helmet opening on the side. Good optics and well worth the cost for safety... even if some buddies still say " Hey, look at the Borg!"
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror but a little difficult to mount.
customer_reviews.text: Its nice to be able to really see what's behind with a larger than normal mirror. Great flex support all ball and socket joints. I was unable to use the conventional mound as I do not have holes in My 'Nutcase" helmet. I driledl a few strategic holes in the mount and helmet, trimmed the mount foot a little and screwed the mounting foot right to the helmet. You just have to be sure that it's exactly where You want it. Also it's then not easily transferrable to another helmet. The quality if the mirror and the size and way it adjusts made the reengineering worth the trouble of redesigning the mount.
customer_reviews.author: David Douglas

customer_reviews.title: good mirror, stays put, fairly easy to mount on helmet
customer_reviews.text: The mirror is easier to mount than indicated by some other reviews. The key is a little trial and error to get it in a good position before you use the zip ties to secure it. Once secured with zip ties, it stays in place very well. In terms of functionality, I'd give it 5 stars. The only reason for 4 stars is it looks a bit dorky. Then again, I'm a little tired of cyclists all over the place who are clearly more concerned about appearance than functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Dude

customer_reviews.title: piece of junk falls apart too late to return cuz it took too long for my helmet to arrive.
customer_reviews.text: don't waste your money. this is junk. does not hold together, is not stable and the first joint, as well as the mirror joint fall off all the time. this crappy thing is held on by zip ties, that orient backward on the left side. only good for shotgun practice or use as a mirror on the cube farm. overpriced for both.
customer_reviews.author: skipmeißter

customer_reviews.title: Worth the expense.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried an eyeglass mounted mirror as well as another brand that uses double stick tape to hold a mirror. This is the best one. The other options were not stable and I could never get them in the right spot. I've been using this mirror for nearly a year and it is performing like new. You set it in place and it just stays there. You will get no cool points with this mirror but I've never been cool. I don't have to crane my neck to look behind me and it's also great on group rides so I don't inadvertently drop anyone. It's expensive but worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: atgcpaul

customer_reviews.title: Slight learning curve, works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: It always takes me a minute or so to correctly position this mirror each time i use my helmet. But once it’s in place it is very stable. It took me a while to get used to focussing upwards/to the left on something so close to my face.... it kind of takes a special concentrated shallow focus that feels wrong. But it works a treat, especially compared to handle bar mirrors, that require moving your whole gaze down to check for headlights behind you.
customer_reviews.author: R. Whitlock

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and way better than any competitor I have tried
customer_reviews.text: Pricey, but so worth it. Got fed up with the other inferior competitors having problems, falling off, etc. Will not use any other one but this one from now on. So much better and they paid attention to the details, like a larger mirror, the multi-pivot shaft, and the Velcro straps which are WAY better than sticky adhesive. Even though this cost more, you can easily swap it from helmet to helmet since it is designed with the straps!
customer_reviews.author: Edan C

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit on my ABUS Pedelec 2.0 E-bike helmet
customer_reviews.text: I have an Abus Pedelec 2 helmet, and I could not manage to attach the mirror. It is clearly build for standard bike helmets. I had to return it. Perhaps I should have checked out the mirror's helmet compatibility prior to ordering, or the product description could have been clearer. Hence, I give it a three star review, right in the middle. I am sure it works well on a standard biking helmet, but cannot verify this. The return process was painless and free, dropping off at an UPS store around the corner. Only a label was required.
customer_reviews.author: J. Katz

customer_reviews.title: DON’T RECOMMEND FOR EYEGLASSES
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Hard to adjust my sight to the mirror to look since I wear glasses. Don’t recommend if you wear glasses.
customer_reviews.author: MaVic2184

customer_reviews.title: Best bike mirror I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Best bike mirror I've ever bought. I was wearing a wrist mirror, because the bike mirrors seemed so small. But this solved a lot, the mirror is decent sized and I can see even better what's coming up behind me. Do go to the website before trying to assemble. You have to boil some water and put one part of the plastic in for a few minutes to get it to fit inside the other piece. If I hadn't gone to the website I would've been extremely frustrated as I continued trying to snap the pieces together.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy70

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! The best mirror for me!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Once the position is correct, a welcome addition to my rides. The bar end mirrors I’ve used wanna lose position every few potholes. This doesn’t. It looks odd, but I don’t care since it can save my life! One of the challenges I face is that my left eye focuses very slowly. I end up using my right eye and a bar end on the right is useless and on the left requires odd angles and lots of head turning. I can put this so my right eye can see. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Al SwansonTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Intuitive mirror, with no vibration or searching for the 'right' view.
customer_reviews.text: Stop over thinking this. You're looking at one that is 3.5x the cost of your last one - because the last one(s) didn't work. The thin wire ones vibrate. The mirrors are unclear. Small sizes requires too much location of the mirror, then focusing and positioning, all while moving. Sound familiar? This one solves it all. Easily positions, no vibration, clear optical reflection and the large size makes it intuitive. Glance left and you instantly can process the view behind you. No searching, focusing, thinking. You've seen it all. Click Buy It Now.
customer_reviews.author: MarkC

customer_reviews.title: worth the $$$$$
customer_reviews.text: one review i read said, "what are you waiting for Its expensive but worth it" Yes at $40 it IS expensive. Tried it out today, like a charm, bright large mirror. super stable. Note I wear a ... Helmet. I tried like hell to get straps to work, no luck. I used Gorilla Glue, worked like a charm. So nice to see behind you, a relief.
customer_reviews.author: Terry J. Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Get off the fence and buy it, you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.text: I cycle commute to work, I ride WITH traffic on the street with the cars. No vibrations, very clear image. This is not like a car side mirror, you don't "glance" at it. You turn your head left slightly to see behind you. Tilting your head up and left lets you see behind you down hills or if you have a backpack. If your backpack is in the way even looking up, just sit up to look. All in all the best tool I have bought for my commute.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Heiland

customer_reviews.title: Very large
customer_reviews.text: The unit was very well put together. However it was quite large and really got in the way. I was thinking it would be a little smaller. I tried to adjust and it really stood out quite a bit. It was a good product but too large for my liking.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Riley

customer_reviews.title: Size does matter!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using one-inch rear-view helmet mirrors for 20 years, and decided to take the plunge and try this larger size. The larger mirror size makes riding safer and more enjoyable. I did a 40-mile ride the first day with this mirror, and the mirror positioning stayed rock solid the whole time. Making small adjustments on the fly is easy when you palm the back of the mirror with your hand, per the user instructions. Provides an excellent, bright view. I should have made this move years ago!
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: These are the best you're going to find
customer_reviews.text: I have wasted around $300 buying bicycle mirrors the ones that you clip on your shades. The ones that you clip onto your bike handlebars the ones that you clip on to your helmets. I should have wrote this review earlier these are the best so get out your $40 and by these things they are incredible I will never ride without these no I don't work for the company I just want my fellow bicycle Riders to be safe
customer_reviews.author: fred

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special for what you pay.
customer_reviews.text: While this mirror is satisfactory in performance, there is nothing about the mirror that justifies the price. The view of objects (cars, trucks) behind you is no bigger than with a $12 helmet mirror. You just see more to the sides with a slightly larger mirror. The mirror WILL work with a full size DaBrim helmet sun shade and has no problem with a normal helmet visor. No one else makes as large a helmet mirror, so they have the market cornered and price it accordingly. That’s how capitalism works. $18 would be too much for this mirror. $40 is a joke. I’ll stick with my old helmet mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Crazyfuyu

customer_reviews.title: Large Mirror & Clarity Best Ever
customer_reviews.text: This mirror seemed oversized compared to all my other mirrors I have used over the years, but when you can see so clearly in such a wide angle behind you, it all makes sense. This mirror is twice the cost of every other mirror I have ever bought but if it saves my life by seeing traffic more clearly, it will be the cheapest mirror I have ever bought. I love this product and recommend it most highly!
customer_reviews.author: jockbroker

customer_reviews.title: I wish it could be a convex mirror
customer_reviews.text: It is a good mirror overall, but it didn't work for me no matter how hard I tried to find a position for it. A filed of view remained pretty limited, so I had to play with a mirror all the time during my ride. I guess it completely counterbalanced ride safety which this mirror was supposed to add in the first place. Most likely, a convex mirror would fix this issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a mirror I've used for years. But is no longer made. I attached the mirror with zip ties. It is rock solid. No movement at all. I positioned it so I do not have to move or tilt my head to see behind me. I just glance at the mirror. Wish I had bought this years ago. The mirror is large but it makes it easy to see behind you. Just ordered a second on for my other helmet. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: I am 69 and just started biking again. Unfortunately, so many people are on the phone it gets scary. I wanted a mirror that was big enough to see cars behind me. It works great. I will say it takes a little to get used to since you have to move your head to see in the right direction. It isn't like a side car rear view mirror that is stationary. Most bike mirrors are smaller so I liked this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry M. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: This One Works
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many bicycle mirrors, and found all of them unacceptable until this one. I can see approaching vehicles many times the distance where my Garmin Varia RTL510 Radar picks them up. It is nice to be able to easily distinguish between a small car and an approaching 18 wheeler by just moving my eye a bit to the left. The mirror was easy to install, easy to adjust, and has little to no vibration riding on the highway shoulder. I would highly recommend this mirror. It is a large dorky looking piece of kit that will help keep you safe.
customer_reviews.author: R Hale

customer_reviews.title: What you see is what you get
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a mirror before but it took some time to figure out how to line it up so I could see behind me. It took a few rides but I figured it out and now I wouldn't be caught dead without it. Quite nice to know when a vehicle is going to come roaring past. I had a friend who offered to drill holes in my helmet to fasten it more securely, but not necessary. I'm very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: tkit

customer_reviews.title: Not fun to install
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I have suffered mirrors that ostensibly glue on to the helmet, only to have them slip. This unit does lash to the helmet so the issue of shifting is eliminated. Installing it is best done with 3 hands. There are zip ties and Velcro straps included, but they would be well advised to also add some adhesive strips on the underside so the mirror can be gently affixed to the helmet while you try to lash it down. I am using the Velcro straps for now until I can be sure it is mounted properly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stoll

customer_reviews.title: Big views, stable on helmet, some patience required
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is so much better and bigger than my previous one. Much better views from behind. Installation can be tricky, depending on helmet size and openings, but very flexible with the quick ties. I used The Velcro straps to make sure I like the position before switching to the ties. Also adjusting the mirror was tricky at first. My wife kept pulling the mirror apart until we practiced with the articulating joints. Once it’s adjusted, it stays put (until you take the helmet off and drop it in the back seat)
customer_reviews.author: optocop

customer_reviews.title: It's been a year and I still love it.
customer_reviews.text: I was riding last night with friends and realized this mirror has worked so well and been so hassle-free I haven't even thought about it for a year. And sure enough I ordered it a year and 5 months ago. Not much else to say, it's stable, pretty easy to attach, although be careful not to tighten the zip ties so much it cuts into the foam of your helmet. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: The Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It lived up to my expectations
customer_reviews.text: The mirror is the largest one I could find. I ride a recumbent cycle, and it's hard to turn my head and look behind me, just because of the way I sit. So good mirror is very important. This mirror stem stiff and stable - it holds position well even when my helmet is riding around in the cab of my truck. It was easy to attach to my helmet, and holds firmly in place.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: I have used handle bar mirrors on all of the recumbents I have ridden. I stayed away from helmet mirrors because they are to small, not now. I love this mirror; it is easy to install and easy to adjust. I ride on a bumpy bike trail most of the time and the mirror stays put. The only time I need to readjust it is when I forget about it and hit the door with the mirror or drop my helmet. It stays put and lets me see who is behind me while watching who is in front of me. I have found my new mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Edmond G Brush

customer_reviews.title: Great view
customer_reviews.text: I'm a roadie, and, having been hit too many times, I was happy to find this mirror. Granted, it's no guarantee against being hit again, but I have a much larger field of vision in this rearview than I had in my standard glasses-mounted one. I didn't realize what I was missing until I found this. I found it by looking online at ratings of cycling mirrors. It is a bit heavy, but I suppose that's a small price to pay.
customer_reviews.author: Gayda

customer_reviews.title: " you may not like having a big mirror
customer_reviews.text: As a biker in his late 60's I don't have as much flexibility in my neck as I once had and a mirror helps me see what's coming from behind. I have used a small mirror for years and it worked well. The Safe Zone mirror is a significant improvement. It provides a broad, crisp, clear view and is very stable. It stays where you set it. It is large and takes just a little getting used to. If you are concerned about looking "cool," you may not like having a big mirror. It you are more concerned about staying alive and seeing what is behind you then get the mirror.
customer_reviews.author: JO

customer_reviews.title: Best mirror I have tried
customer_reviews.text: It is a challenge finding the best mounting location, but once you find it, it works better than any thing else I have tried. it works best to start with all the links of the mounting arm adjusted for the arm to be straight. Then try to locate the helmet mount so that only the swivel connections at the ends need to be adjusted. This gets the mirror as far away from the helmet as possible without adding extra links.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Wilber

customer_reviews.title: Great vision at 1 foot. Blurry beyond that.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this setup. I had seen it advertised on bike Portland. I tried different attachments to line it up with my left eye. Keep in mind the bike peddler version puts it right in line with your eye. Anyhow, after finding a good spot, it's obvious the glass is not totally flat. I have incredible clear views of my left ear and left helmet strap. Everything 5 feet and back is blurry. No, I am wearing my glasses. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Crawdad123Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: I hate these articulated designs. If I had realized it was one I would not have bought it. Hard to attach and adjust. You need to be careful when adjusting it or it will snap apart at one of the joints. It’s happened twice so far. I hate it. I’ve tried it on a couple rides and getting it positioned correctly is awful. I will be sending it back. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: tehkdork

customer_reviews.title: Good visibility, plenty of tie wraps. Remove the protective film on mirror before use.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with a wide and deep field of view. Faster for checking traffic than using a handlebar-end mirror. You can easily adjust the flexi-stem to see a good view in your typical riding position. I still find that I may have to swivel my head slightly to "tune" the view depending on where I want to look. Be sure to remove the protective plastic film. It's not mentioned in the instructions and at first I didn't realize that it was there; it looked like a dull aluminum disk instead of a mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust and solidly built. Large mirror
customer_reviews.text: Nice device and easy to fit onto my helmet with velcro. A nice touch as I decided to move it to my right side after first installing it. A large mirror that I find much more useful than typical small mirrors. Didn't move at all in the wind I rode in the other day.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pierskalla

customer_reviews.title: Large, stable, and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've tried 2 or 3 other bike mirrors before this one (on the handlebar, on the helmet). I prefer mirrors mounted on the helmet because it's much easier and faster to turn my neck to adjust for the right view. This one is easy to mount on my helmet and it doesn't cause any discomfort. Beware of those that need to be mounted on the inside of the helmet; they put pressure on your head.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Needs longer tubes by about 4-6”
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. The flexible tubes that they send are not long enough. We put the tubes together so that we had enough tubing for one helmet, then I ordered more 1/4” tubing from Loc Line so we could mount the mirror on the second helmet. The system works when you have enough tubing to adjust the mirror out to the side of your helmet so that you can see behind you and keep the mirror out of your line of sight in the front.
customer_reviews.author: aacgalhere

customer_reviews.title: Feel safer riding on the road now
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike mirror. Design allows you to adjust positioning to your liking. Stays in place during ride once position is set. Would recommend mounting on helmet so that mirror is around 5” from face. Kit comes with some tie straps & velcro wraps to use to secure mirror to helmet. I used the tie straps and snugged them up and mirror is staying in place. Feel safer riding now with this mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Gmar459

customer_reviews.title: Just Ehhhh
customer_reviews.text: If you care about how things look, you might want to pass on this one. It's crazy large - not cool at all. It's difficult to adjust to the right spot and once you do get it adjusted, it doesn't stay in position over time. We ride a lot and for long distances so it just wasn't a good fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Owens

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that my helmet mirror came loose last week. I love the product so was planning to order a replacement when I noticed a 5 year no conditions warranty so I called them and while it appears I could reattach it after expanding the bracket, they offered to replace the arm and mirror. This unit was 15 months old so I am pleased and plan to order a second one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Ron F.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but bulky and ugly, best mirror I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Stable, sturdy, doesn’t move or come off. Largest helmet mirror on market, gives confidence. Only drawback: large, bulky, ugly, relatively heavy compared to others on the market. If Safety is your top priority, then this is the mirror for you. If weight and bulk matter, there are smaller and lighter ones on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Harley W.

customer_reviews.title: Good but quality isn't there for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the design, but pretty low quality plastic for the price - one of the sections broke while I was attaching it to the helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Ksenia

customer_reviews.title: Durable, great installation, and transferrable if I get a new helmet, and wonderful mirror!
customer_reviews.text: Love this rear-view helmet mirror. Durable. Easy to install. Transferrable to another helmet when this one needs replacing. Yup, it was spendy. Yup, it was worth it. I love being able to see what's behind me when I'm cycling, and this is much safer for my particular bike than anything that would attach to the handlebars. I'm a happy person!
customer_reviews.author: a's pen name

customer_reviews.title: it works just fine. I never used a mirror before
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the mirror position and strapped onto helmet and you get the viewing adjusted while riding, it works just fine. I never used a mirror before, so I needed time to get comfortable with looking into mirror. Just remember, its not like your in a car, your head is always moving and you have to move your head at times to get the perfect angle. I ride a road-bike so I move from top handle bar to lower bars periodically which would move the mirror angle somewhat. I think the cost at 40.00 is somewhat high but it was the only mirror with larger surface area and flexible arm.
customer_reviews.author: Simplicity7

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is designed well and does its job better than any other helmet mirror I have found (and I've tried a few). Only small issue experienced has been with the assembly popping off the ball at its base during adjustment but it pops right back on and you learn to adjust it without having this happen. I did need to contact the EVT (the seller and designer) and received excellent support (prompt, courteous and fully satisfactory).
customer_reviews.author: Joe Burgart

customer_reviews.title: Big Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Tried different attachment locations and just did not fit . My helmet Specialized Eschalon 2 with MIPS would not accommodate the zip ties/straps- had to try and slide under MIPS layer, (so the layer would slide if needed in an accident). Some helmet air grooves were tapered so the straps slide on them and could not be tightened and stay in place. Went and am now using a bar end mount mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Jimb

customer_reviews.title: It wants to work but fails somewhat
customer_reviews.text: You will either like or not. For me the mirror is just too invasive & it never did set right to be used safely. When adjusting arm, well that just wants to pop out. Yes it is cheaply made - all bike mirrors are cheap. Bravo to inventor for giving it a go. Not the 90’s anymore where we could get hats & shoes that fit well & specialty items made with consciousness.
customer_reviews.author: Wind Sock @ RedTop Landing

customer_reviews.title: Best rear view mirror for cycling there is.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Safe Zone helmet mirror for cycling since 2013 when I bought it on Amazon. I love this mirror. It is the best. The large size gives you a great field of vision and it is rock solid. Doesn't budge out of position and easy to adjust when you are on the road. I have even packed it overseas when cycling in Europe. Wouldn't be without it. If you have never used a helmet mirror before, cut right to the chase and get the best one on the market and get the Safe Zone. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie 7511

customer_reviews.title: Will never ride without again
customer_reviews.text: Have used them only once so far - and I’ll never ride without again. Took a bit of fiddling to figure out how I was going to attach to my bell helmet. But even with just 3 Velcro toes it is stable and provides a shame free view behind me. I’ll probably switch to the zip ties after a few more rides. I am very pleased with this mirror
customer_reviews.author: Bob K.

customer_reviews.title: thought it was going to work good, I had no idea!!
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic, the field of vision is so much bigger than the old style wire ones and the ability to articulate the mirror also unbelievable zip ties with either plastic or velcro straps included make it pretty easy to attach to pretty much any bike helmet I can also say this is probably the biggest reason to buy of all the level of my stress knowing what is coming up behind me because my town is notorious for terrible drivers. so worth it if you are going out on the road always watch out for the other guy!!!
customer_reviews.author: colby

customer_reviews.title: It mounted to my helmet easily, and it's very secure
customer_reviews.text: I tried a few other mirrors; some attached to helmets, some clipped to glasses. All were more of a distraction than a help, but they were also smaller mirrors. I've been using this one for about a week. It mounted to my helmet easily, and it's very secure. It adjusts easily and stays put. I'll update this if my experience changes, but for right now, I think I've finally found a mirror worth having.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: The BEST and only mirror you need while biking!
customer_reviews.text: I road bike about 4,000 miles per year and I LOVE this mirror. Have tried other helmet mirrors but this is the BEST and SAFEST mirror! Won't bike without it. Your focus stays on the road with only a quick glance in the EVT mirror. Handlebar mirrors require your focus to shift away from the road for a second but long enough to miss an obstacle or sudden stop of biker in front of you. Easy to be more aware of bad drivers approaching from behind also! As far as I am concerned, this is the only mirror you need when biking!
customer_reviews.author: cimama

customer_reviews.title: Safety is paramount
customer_reviews.text: Easy to attach and is very stable. The mirror is larger than others I have had and gives a larger field of view. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Sones

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price! This is my 3rd mirror, and I hope the last. It’s all it’s advertised to be. I thought the larger size might be a bit much but it isn’t and I appreciate the larger viewing area. I especially like the fact that I don’t have to adjust it; once adjusted it is the same every time I put on my helmet.
customer_reviews.author: AnneEliz

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mirror with large viewing area
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading from a riding mirror that attached to my glasses, to this mirror that attached to the helmet was a great improvement in my ride safety and position. The helmet mounted mirror provides a much larger viewing area on the mirror's surface. Mounted on my helmet the mirror also does not move around, as my old glasses mounted mirror did as the glasses slid on my face often in the heat. The mirror arrived with ample permanent and removable (velcro) mounting to allow me to test position the mirror on several locations on my helmet. The mirror can also be removed from the mount for easier transport. Very happy with this purchase! I would definitely recommend to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: TAP

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: after figuring out how to install it, it works well. mind you that : 1. each one of the tube links can be moved to a different direction 2. it is written in the installation guide but make sure that the mirror is about 10 cm from your eye. after this was clear it is working very good.
customer_reviews.author: roni

customer_reviews.title: Stable, large mirror very adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, it attached to the helmet easily. The mirror is stable and not jiggly when looking in the mirror. The arm is flexible. mirror is large enough to see everything behind me. The arm is all plastic so nothing will rust or corrode. The only this is that I think I look a bit goofy with this mirror on my helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Chong

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mirror
customer_reviews.text: A perfect addition to my helmet. Provides an excellent view of what’s coming up from behind me. Good size mirror that can be glanced at quite easily while riding. Once positioned it stays where you’ve adjusted it. I fastened it with nylon zip ties through the holes in the helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wally

customer_reviews.title: Excellent helmet mirror with wide view range
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is excellent. It gives me a wide sight range and the adjustments that can be made are endless. I've had both handlebar mirrors and those little tiny eyeglass ones. The EVT, while a little pricey, is well worth the money. It is heavy duty and affixes easily to my helmet. I haven't put in on permanently yet, as I want a new helmet when I do that.
customer_reviews.author: media girl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stable adjustable helmet mirror!
customer_reviews.text: Love this helmet rearview mirror. It is large, lightweight and adjustable without being in your line of sight. It is very clear to see behind you in a glance due the glass finish mirror. Love that it gives you three Velcro zip ties to be sure to get it in the proper location. Then you can replace with the provided plastic zip ties. I would gladly purchase this again. So glad I found this.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie Davis

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love the stability of this mirror. It stays where you put it even on bumpy rides. The only issue I had with it was the installation. It took about 15 minutes to get it attached to my helmet. But, my love of the mirror wouldn’t allow me to take a star away because of it!
customer_reviews.author: M Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great field of view, stays put when adjusted
customer_reviews.text: It's light enough where I don't even notice it's there, which can be annoying when I'm off the bike and jam it into something. Fortunately, it's easy to get back in position and it holds that position well if I can keep from hitting anything with it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Carter

customer_reviews.title: Best bike mirror
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the greatest bike accessories I've ever bought. I use it every single day, and it makes a huge difference. I've used handlebar mirrors and other helmet mirrors in the past and none compare. It's easy to attach, easy to adjust, and very durable (I've had mine for 5 years, through two accidents). I recommend them to everyone. They're pricey (for a bike mirror, I suppose) but worth it. The large size gives a great view of what's behind you. UPDATE: 3 more years, still going strong. I recommend this mirror to everyone who is getting into bike commuting.
customer_reviews.author: David Royal

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Comfort? Stability? How about more of a dangerous distraction than a safety aid? You’ll be hard pressed to find a good angle before you actually hit the road, and then it’s too late to change the angle of it in a meaningful or safe way. It’s a complete waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Salbo

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The mirror is plenty large enough to give you a great view of what's behind you. Some might say it borders on too large. But I like the view. The flexible arm holds the mirror in place better than any mirror I have used. It stays in place perfectly on my road bike. I can't comment on how it will work on the trails. Due to my helmet style I could not mount the mirror using zip ties. So I used duct tape. Worked great, but not the prettiest installation. I plan to improve the aesthetics before spring.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C

customer_reviews.title: best quality mirror
customer_reviews.text: Not cheap at $40 but well worth it. The best quality bike mirror I've found. Very solid. Stays where I need it to be. Took me numerous times to get it just where I wanted it but when I did, very satisfied. Very valuable to just use your peripheral vision to always know where traffic is. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: randoggy

customer_reviews.title: No problem seeing what's behind me.
customer_reviews.text: I had some trouble fastening the mirror to the helmet at first, and I was concerned that it would not be stable enough to stay aimed in the right direction, but after a couple retries I managed to get all the ties (2 kinds) on, and it is a good solid fit, and the mirror is much bigger than the one I used to use, providing a good rear view.
customer_reviews.author: bart

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: There was a manufacturing flaw in the first item sent which was quickly rectified by the company. The customer service was fantastic. I'm pleased with the mirror so far, but only used it once. I don't foresee a problem with it. I attached it to my helmet using the included velcro strips but will better secure them with zip ties which were also included. It's a bit pricey but it's a good product and a responsive company.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great Mirror, Great Service.
customer_reviews.text: Have used bike mirrors for 35+ years. Tried all makes and styles. This is by far my favorite. I bought one in September 2014 and recently (March 2017) somehow got a big scratch across the mirror. I called them and they are sending a free replacement right out. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Unsuccessful in getting a stable fit when attaching to helmet. Also, not easy to align to see enough behind. The mirror on the handlebars is still the best. I missed my window of return, but I would not buy again. Now looking to give it away.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: Waited until I got some use out of this. It is AWESOME. First time I rode I felt so much more comfortable and safer. 450 miles later and worth every penny. Easy to readjust while riding. Never bounces. The big mirror isn’t too big at all and you can see so much behind you. Just buy it. Look no further!!
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to get/stay in position
customer_reviews.text: Can easily add to helmet, but difficult to get into a useful position. If you move your head then of course you view changes a lot. Have to readjust the position a lot during the ride. I have ended up not using these, and may get a bike mounted mirror instead

product_meta.title: EVT Safe Zone Bicycle Helmet Mirror
product_meta.description: The American-made Safe Zone Bicycle Helmet Mirror is simply the highest-quality helmet-mounted bicycle mirror on the market. Thousands of our customers agree, and often tell us that they find our product is superior in functionality and durability to all competing helmet mirrors. The 2.25" mirror yields an extremely wide field of view, much larger than any other helmet mirror. The sturdy mounting is unparalleled - no weak adhesives or fragile parts to worry about! The arm is easy to adjust, maintains functionality and is guaranteed not to loosen over time. Simply attach the mirror base to the helmet with the included straps, straighten the mirror arm, and snap the mirror directly into the base to install. Once it's installed, peel off the plastic film protecting the mirror. For any mounting difficulties please contact us directly at 971-258-0925 or view the detailed photos and videos on the Safe Zone Installation tab on efficientvelo.com. The Safe Zone Mirror will fit nearly all helmets and we'll provide advice and free supplies to make the mirror work as needed. Another benefit unique to the Safe Zone Helmet Mirror is our unmatched five-year "No-Fault" warranty that comes standard with your purchase. We stand behind our products and personally service this warranty, so you don't have to worry about your bicycle rear-view needs for the length of our warranty. Try cycling the Safe Zone way! We're sure you'll agree that the Safe Zone is the most effective bicycle helmet mirror made. Please note the Safe Zone ships with a protective plastic film over mirror which must be removed before first use. Once you have the mirror mounted on your helmet, we recommend doing all major adjustments when you're not riding, and with your hand bracing the breakaway point. Once you have it adjusted to a good spot where you can see behind you and it's not blocking the main field of vision for you, you can do "micro adjustments" by moving the mirror when you're on a ride.
feature_bullets: Huge 2 & 1/4" mirror provides safest view of what's behind you
VERY sturdy construction. Does not vibrate. Stays in Place!
Linked arm is easy to adjust, and holds position
100% U.S.A. Made from high quality materials
Installation help and 5 year "No-Fault" warranty from manufacturer.
